title: The Philosophy of Antifragility
excerpt: Chaos is not just to be survived, but used.
content:
Antifragility is a property of systems that increase in capability to thrive as a result of stressors, shocks, volatility, noise, mistakes, faults, attacks, or failures.

> "Wind extinguishes a candle and energizes fire." - Nassim Nicholas Taleb

### Key Concepts

- **Fragile**: Breaks under stress.
- **Robust**: Resists stress.
- **Antifragile**: Gets better with stress.

Applying this to your life means seeking out challenges that don't kill you, but make you stronger.

title: Bitcoin Halving Explained
excerpt: What happens when the block reward cuts in half?
content:
Every 210,000 blocks, or roughly every four years, the block reward given to Bitcoin miners for processing transactions is cut in half. This event is referred to as halving.

## Historical Impact

Historically, halvings have been associated with significant price increases in the months following the event due to the reduced supply issuance.

![Bitcoin Chart](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1518546305927-5a555bb7020d?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80)

*Note: Past performance is not indicative of future results.*
